author: YC Ang
text: Had a quick workout here while I was in the area for an appointment. It is really as bad as mentioned in recent reviews. Not having new equipment is not a huge issue if well-maintained. Running a gym without proper maintenance is really unacceptable and seems insincere.

author: Hana Leong
text:
I can't believe I wasted my hard-earned cash on this dump! The staff is probably the only redeeming factor, but even they can't save this place from being an absolute nightmare. This gym is a disgrace to Singapore! It's like stepping into a horror movie set – broken soap dispensers, rusty equipment, and upholstery that's seen better days. And don't even get me started on the off calibrated machines and blinking lights. The aircon feels like it's blowing warm swamp air, and the whole place reeks of musty desperation. It's such a shame because this gym could have been something great, but instead, it's just a sad, neglected mess. Save your money and your sanity – steer clear of this disaster zone!

I’d rather pay $2.50per entry for activesg at Hougang Stadium

author: Jacynda Teo
text:
While the AF Kovan branch boasts a larger layout compared to other North East outlets, the narrow rectangular side makes it quite inconvenient. It’s challenging to navigate the space, especially when people carrying weights have to maneuver through—everyone else has to step aside, which can be quite frustrating.

Many of the seats on the machines were torn, and several of the bars were rusty. This level of neglect is concerning and reflects poorly on the overall maintenance of the facility.

What truly horrified me, however, was the condition of the facilities. After using their DIY soap and kitchen towel to clean my hands, I found them covered in rust! It’s incredibly off-putting and raises serious concerns about cleanliness and maintenance.

I hope the management addresses these issues soon, but based on my experience, I can’t recommend this branch at the moment.

author: Lirene Bay
text:
One of the worst AF I been around by far. I still got there because I am a fanatic of BodyCombat class and they are the only AF I know about with Sunday class. The airconditioning in the studio were so bad, its like the warmest BodyCombat I been. Fortunately they have a fun instructor, otherwise I don’t think anyone want to be there.
Gym facilities are bad. Need serious maintenance and de rusting. I seen other AF crews did that and don’t understand why this AF can’t. You get your hand all dirty by touching their equipment.

author: J L
text:
Waited to fairly review this post ‘renovation’.
Aesthetics still as clinical and ugly as ever sadly. Huge gym space but poorly utilised. Dumb bell area could easily fit 4 full racks whilst moving the dumb bell area strategically closer to where the bag area is now. They got the standing tables blocking up space across the whole gym from when the place used to be a bowling lounge or something so they work around the structures from prior leases for an even worse placement of gym equipment.
Almost felt like a renovation was announced and done just to label it one when it made no functional improvements; man even the aesthetic improvements were like a 2/10 to a 2.5/10.
Gym needs a MAJOR makeover from placement of equipment to just about everything else. One of THE WORST gyms available in Singapore, might even be worse than some public gyms. PLEASE, do something about this gym. I’m bouta crash out having this gym as my closest gym. It’s bloody terrible.

author: Jiehong Yo
text: I had a really unpleasant experience with one of your trainers today. He was a skinny guy with long hair and glasses. I had simply taken a Tele bubble, and he immediately assumed I was recording him, which was not the case at all. His reaction was unnecessarily rude and confrontational. I found this behavior completely unacceptable, especially in a gym environment where members should feel comfortable and respected. Please look into this matter.

author: Aze Lee
text:
I've been a member of this amazing club for the last 7 years. Super friendly team especially the BA Shilah. Big gym, has tonnes of equipments including functional, boxing, ski erg. They recently just renovated and I love the fresh new look. They have a dedicated studio for group classes like Strong Nation, Circl Mobility, Zumba, Body Combat, Yoga, and Pilates. I've also been doing PT with Khai and he makes sure to make every single session a killer. But the results speak for itself.

The toilets could do with better ventilation but other than that, I'm happy and proud to be a member of Anytime Fitness Kovan.

author: Geraldine Goh
text: This has to be the biggest Anytime Fitness gym in Singapore. The gym is so spacious and they have a wide variety of equipment and machines. I love that you can take a look at the bowling alleys below the gym when you are taking a break. They even have a big LCD screen that plays workout videos that you can watch while exercising.

author: Danial Syafiq
text: the female brand ambassador raised her voice to sound off that i need to have a towel in order to use the gym. 1 hour into the workout, the gym equipments is covered in sweat stains and i have to wipe the bench myself. defeat the purpose of bringing the towel and not wiping after use. and other gym users seem to have not have the towel with them. this is my first time visiting this outlet and it will be the last time. in addition, the gym has a musky smell.

author: Pringles
text:
Go here if you want...

Rude staff that talks behind your back...
Have broken equipment that takes forever to get replaced...
Machines to be over greased, so your weights fall off and your clothes get dirty and you can't get rid of the grease stains,so you need to throw away your expensive workout clothes...
Broken up floors...
Dirty gym...
Cleaner who will throw the vacuum cleaner cable over your exercise matt, your gym equipment and doesn't care if you can trip over the cable either...
Aircon that doesn't work properly and continuously drips...
If you want to use the equipment for your texting sessions...
Want to get COVID-19...
Don't want 24 hour fitness...
Enjoy trainers who don't care if you do an exercise wrongly, even though you could injure yourself...
Want people to scream and curse in the early mornings and intimate women...while the management can't be bothered to tell that person off but rather chooses to tell the woman to come to different hours to workout...
Go here if you want to be locked out on your last day of contract...even though management and 1 other staff confirmed contract cancelation date...
You want below average gym, gym equipment and staff...then go here and "be average"!

So much more to write but I will save it for the Singapore Sports Council!

author: Loh Zhi Yang
text:
No 1.25kg and 2.5kg plates - even basic gyms have those.
The worst part is that they used to have them but intentionally removed them. Who knows which equipment will be randomly removed next?

Edit:
Increased rating because they brought back the 1.25kg and 2.5kg plates (only one set though)

author: Andrew Seah
text: Not sure what is the purpose of having Club Rules when AF staff don't even practice what they preached (Rule 7). They goes around telling ppl to abide the rules but failed to ensure their personal trainees  do so as well. Or is it a case whereby members who signed for their personal training are excused?! Double standards.

author: Ashley Gabasa
text: The lady club manager loudly insisted that I needed a towel to use the gym, showing a lack of customer service training. She was rude and disrespectful, not even listening to what I had to say, and insisted that I buy a towel. While I understand it's the club's policy, there's a better way to communicate it. This isn't my first time visiting this gym, but if she wants to strictly enforce the rules, she should also ensure that gym-goers are wiping down equipment after use. The rules aren't even applied consistently, as other staff members don't enforce them either. Her behavior made everyone uncomfortable, with some people leaving as a result. Additionally, the gym had a musky odor.

author: Sharyn Lim Pei Hwern
text: First time entering Kovan AF and my tumblr got stolen. It happened around 10pm+. Have texted them so let's see how they will manage the situation.

author: Sienna V
text:
Place is kind of falling apart,  rusty equipments with grips that are shredded, just feels sad being here. Some of the dumbbells are rusty and cut my hands.

It's also poorly ventilated, the toilets  are consistently nasty, and rules are not enforced (gym  sweat hygiene, reracking, men using the women's bathrooms)

It's a shame as the space is huge with lots of potential.

I may have signed up to this gym but other AFs have better facilities.

author: ssa j
text: Newly renovated gym.. great effort and conveniently located in the heartland of Kovan.

author: Calvin Leong
text: Gym is spacious and equipped, however, staff is unfriendly, you don't feel welcome when you're there, they won't say hi, or try to talk to members, only black faces. Fees is not properly explained when you join, I walk into their office and inform them of card change. The staff just swipe my card without asking me, realised I got charge $15 late fee, should have inform me before charging it, won't renew at this gym for sure

author: G P
text:
The staff here are really friendly and helpful.

Some of the equipment is showing signs of aging and needs replacing.

The space is clean and well-maintained.    An area that could be improved is the bathrooms.  They floors are quite wet.

author: Karen K
text:
Excellent place to workout. It's one of the most spacious anytime fitness outlets. The staff are really friendly and approachable. Equipment is well maintained and i am satisfied with the quantity and quality of equipment. No need to wait and queue for the cardio machines.
Very clean place too. The cleaners have done a good job.

They have a separate space for the studio which is especially conducive for yoga classes. They have very good instructors too.

author: Siew Hing Lam
text: It's one of the best gym that I ever go to. The place is clean. Maybe it's due to newly open. The equipment's are well maintain. It's not overly crowded too. Just around the corner, you can find a cafe as well that looks not too bad. Below three gym, there's a bowling alley as well for other recreation too. A good spot to continue your workout session and best of all, it's 24 hours.

author: indra arman
text: Place is clean and all the equipments are well maintained

author: György Jung
text: Clean, well-equipped gym. Friendly staff. On top of a bowling alley. Only accessible via a staircase. Clean toilets and showers. QR code entry, self temperature check. Pleasant until about 5:30 pm, then it gets crowded for my taste.

author: Geraldine Lim
text: The gym is well spaced and the staff is friendly but I think the machines really need an upgrade. Some of the handles are falling apart. Also they don't have alot of the newer equipments like a hip thrust machine.

author: Khad B.
text: Good gym time..hopefully aircon is always cold like today. Has shower too

author: Lim Siang Heng
text: Good space in the gym. However you can never cancel your membership after signing up, they kept charging even after acknowledging the cancellation of membership. Had to change my credit card to avoid more charges. Even so, they called to get my new card saying they needed it for refund, which they did for 1 month. Then charge me for the next month again. This is more like SCAM gym?

author: Daniel “Pringles”
text:
My updated review after 18 months.

Aircon either not working, not working properly or dripping onto you, if you forget and accidentally walk underneath it.

Since about 6 months plated weights started to break down because people are using it to elevate benches. Looks like cookie monster came in and started chewing. Staff knows but people in anytime fitness kovan, can do as they please. Seems that staff doesn't want to approach members because they don't want the conflict.

Lots of people train completely wrong but staff also can't be bothered to correct these people, which eventually will lead to injuries and additionally will also teach unexperienced members, wrong techniques.

Lots of times you go there and it's so crowded that you can't even excercise properly because people just occupy machines and text, rather than workout.

Lots of people don't disinfect the machines after use or use a towel, while staff will just ignore.

Decided not to extend my contract.. Because it has changed from anytime fitness to anytime fitness when it's convenient for me opening hours.

They chat opening hours just because not enough people go at night/early morning.

Much more to write and not enough space..

author: Desmond Tan
text: One of the largest anytime fitness clubs in singapore. There are a lot of equipment available as well as a virtual class that can allow you to train facing a huge screen. Many shower rooms available as well. The gym is on the second level facing the bowling alley.

author: Gabin Esquibet
text: Agressive employees they don’t know how to talk calm and nice with their customers. They are very aggressive and not respectful with the customers. Gym is ok but not the staff, they have to be trained and get lessons on how to respect their customers.

author: Nguyen Ly
text:
One of the better Anytime Fitness in Singapore. Spacious and good vibe with people mainly just focused on working out.
There is sometimes a bit of a queue at the racks as there are only 2 of them,esp at peak hours.

author: Anotation
text:
Place is kind of falling apart, musky smell, leaky aitrcons that always break down.

Rusty equipments with grips that are shredded, just feels sad being here. It's a shame as the space is huge with lots of potential.

author: Michael G
text: Nice and big but the staff is rude as they don’t acknowledge you or even say hi, just aim the temperature gun at your head and then walk away without saying a word as if you’re a farm animal. Sometimes they even take your workout equipment without asking if you’re using it. Unpleasant to come here. Well equipped though.

author: Samson Aow
text: One of the bigger gyms. Like that it’s convenient and the location is near carparks. The gym have sufficient machines and weights to use. It is very clean too. Enjoyed the facilitates here

author: Jayden Teoh
text: A very good, spacious gym in the north east area. I like the Zumba and yoga classes conducted by Aze & Pam. Staffs are friendly as well.

author: Jaren Foo
text:
Good location in Kovan, near mrt, supermarket and food places.

Good array of free weights and machines to suit all type of gym enthusiasts.

author: ZAIN UL ABDIN
text: worst management of anytime fitness kovan they treat there subscribers very bad and rudely cannot even solve little issues i would recommend everyone to choose other branches

author: Freddy Seah
text: Spacious and equipments adequate.  Friendly staff and trainers.

author: Jewel Tan
text: Scam people money and bad service say will get back back 3 days been a month they will never let you cancel even tho you have doctor proof that there is a health issue that you couldn’t

author: Adrian Lin
text: Some guy took off my 10kg plate while i was resting after i just loaded it on and then after that he reracked  a 5kg and a 10kg onto the machine i was using

author: Shaik Al-afiq
text: Very spacious and clean

author: Shane Lim
text: It's spacious and clean

author: Robert
text: Talk about 24 hrs, came all the way to gym  this morning and people can’t even enter the gym. If the system is so unreliable then don’t call yourself ANYTIME

author: Shakerin
text: Location is good. The gym is big. Enough equipments and well maintained.

author: Jermaine Wong
text: One of the biggest Anytime Fitness outlets in Singapore, friendly staff and adequate equipments. Highly recommend

author: RC
text: Very spacious and good location, even hire FT fitness trainer

author: Hirantha Neranjan
text: Spacious, decent range of equipment and well maintained. However as usual can be quite crowded

author: Edwin Kiew
text: Supposedly one of the largest AF branches in Singapore. Clean and spacious

author: jerome sim
text: I will never complain about the other Anytime gyms after going to this one

author: Tom Joe
text:
Good location, less then 10 minutes
Walking distance to Kovan MRT station.

author: Siang Wei
text: Anytime fitness that’s not 24 hours. Didn’t bother to update new timing which is not even open 12 hours a day

author: Salleh HAMID
text: Great place to enjoy your workout with friendly staff. Vending machine for your workout essentials.

author: daniel k
text: I feel relaxed when I’m in this gym. A little haven from my stressful day.

author: rasied mohd
text: Love the gym, space especially the staff! Congrats 1 yr old.....

author: Mohammad Hatta
text: Friendly and helpful staff! Huda, the manager  is very bubbly and approachable.

author: Johnathan Wong
text: not very clean and quite old equipment.

author: Xavier Tan
text: garbage equipment condition and overly strict rules

author: Joseph Yu (Seph)
text: Second largest AF gym in SG i believe

author: Mav
text: Very well furnished!

author: G Surin
text: great gym

author: Bane Mohd
text: Who don't love Anytime Fitness Kovan??????

author: Roland Soh
text: Old equipments.

author: M
text: Good

author: Tiffany Avi
text: Great place to train!

author: Herddie Norman
text: Clearly one of the best

author: Zamri Rasheed
text: Great place for gym

author: yong xun
text: Rude staff

author: Ram Alisam
text: Good
